@ulrichard: I guess there's always the Source =D

@ZAlex:
> Binchan: 9 hours ago: Reply Musickiller: Those are optional files, so they have less peers and are harder to load.

@ZAlex: .... you also can pin the galary that you want to browse and then wait till it's loaded in the background. More peers = faster loading. For example, demo galary can vbe browsed without pinning.

@Binchan: ~~doing my best~~ having fun.
(I've thought that it's far from the best I can do, so I should change it..) (and it's certainly true about fun)
@ZAlex: really? It's nice and well on my phone..

@空澄砂夜: this fun project may become much larger if you don't drop it. There was a demand for a galary by some people (including me), and yours is the first one that I've ever seen (and it's a good one actually)). Thank you. I'll make my hub as soon as I have time for it.

How do you imagine a decentralized translator? Then it's easier to implement an offline translator support. Like a plugin to either browser or ZeroNet. And by the way, there should be a google translator plugin for browser (to have at least something now)

@空澄砂夜: yes. On the computer it's problematic. [This gallery](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0gallery.bit/?!/g/1D2C23aAoHeoJsvPjZZxS9bt3i93uRVfUP/fractal) (yes, now I know that it's not "gallary" xD), for example. There pictures are too long and one has to scroll or zoom to see it. @ZAlex:
@空澄砂夜: may be you can use that "type" thing? no vertical border for books and make images fit the screen... Because the books should be scrollable, rather than small.

I think that may be a good idea, since I always have some files that just can't update. On the other hand, ZeroNet does not try to update them for too long, and is just marking them as unavailable, though will try to get them the next time it will be updating. May be that's not so bad? I have ZN on my phone and I can't say that those files are eating up too much. (I have 4000 mAh battery, so may be I just can't feel it)
@Binchan: I see. Let's wait and see what the man has to say about it then =D

@霸王寨第一光头: but may be those files would be unavailable no matter how hard you try to block them. So there is not much of a difference.
@Binchan: that sounds like censoring, which is against ZN politics if I'm correct. I also think that may be it's OK that your Pi is overloaded? It does not consume much power anyway, but by trying to get those files it does help the network. Again, correct me if I'm wrong.

@Binchan: good point (about the last message)

ПМоС - sounds funny. I have found only a single screenshot on the site. So it's **that** deep in development?

@Binchan: yes, it really is an interesting thing. I have never liked Pi's loader...
> Does it boot Linux?
>
> Yes, with some conditions. You can boot a very minimal version of Linux without the firmware and get it to work with UART and eMMC. Support for USB, DMA, and Ethernet are in the works, which will be sufficient for certain headless systems. Still, many other peripherals require bringup, such as video. Additionally, drivers for power management need to written.

I certainly wish that project lots of luck.

@Binchan: that's great coz I'm constantly bored and when I'm not I know that I need to think about some new task already because I'll get bored very soon.
